page.title: 12Autumn/winter on the farm.
page.content: AUTUMN In autumn the farmer ploughs, cultivates and then plants the winter wheat, barley and oats. The seed is bought from a seed merchant and comes with a seed dressing that kills certain pests and protects the grain from certain diseases. The seed is put into the ground together with a complete fertilizer that contains nitrogen, phosphate and potash. After planting the ground is sprayed with a weed killer WINTER In winter the sheep and cattle are indoors and so have to be feed and watered. The sheds also have to be cleaned out, the manure is kept to spread on the fields and new bedding straw put down. Some stored corn is sold, the machinery maintained and the hedges are trimmed.
